predicate.note: Frames file for 'feud' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 36.1.

example.name: merged combatants
example.text: Mr. Blair and Hees have been feuding for months.

example.name: separated combatants
example.text: Mr. Tonkin, who *trace* has been feuding with the Big Three since he took office earlier this year, said that with half of the nation's dealers losing money or breaking even, it was time for ``emergency action.''
example.arg: since he took office earlier this year

example.name: with point of contention
example.text: But more recently, the Pentagon and the Commerce Department openly feuded over the extent to which Cocom should liberalize exports of personal computers to the bloc.
example.arg: the Pentagon and the Commerce Department
the extent to which Cocom should liberalize exports of personal computers to the bloc
